fullProgramDescription: The Business Psychology major is an interdisciplinary program that focuses on the application of psychological principles to the business world. The program emphasizes the understanding of human behavior in organizational settings and prepares students for careers in management, human resources, marketing, and other related fields. The curriculum includes coursework in psychology, business, and statistics, providing students with a solid foundation in the principles of business and the skills to apply psychological theory to real-world problems.
shortProgramDescription: The Business Psychology B.S. program applies psychological principles to business settings, preparing students for careers in management, human resources, and marketing.
classHighlights: The Business Psychology major requires a foundation in psychology, including courses such as Introduction to Psychology (PSYC60), Research Methods (PSYC101), and Statistics (PSYC60/161).
Students also complete coursework in business, including Introduction to Business (MGT1), Organizational Behavior (MGT101), and Marketing (MKTG105).
Additional required courses include Business Psychology (PSYC142), Consumer Behavior (MKTG105), and Personnel Psychology (PSYC145).
learningOutcomes: Apply psychological principles to business settings
Understand human behavior in organizational settings
Analyze and interpret data related to business and psychology
Develop effective management and leadership skills
Communicate effectively in written and oral form
creditRequirements: Total: approximately180-200 quarter units; major:62-63 upper-division units in Psychology and Management
additionalInformation: The Business Psychology major is a highly competitive program that requires a supplemental application. Students must meet the major's GPA requirements and complete specific prerequisites to be considered for admission.
